title: Create React Counter Component
description: Build a simple React functional component that implements a counter with increment, decrement, and reset buttons. The counter should be styled with CSS modules and change color based on its value.

steps.title: Set up project
steps.description: Create a new React project using create-react-app. Remove unused boilerplate files.

steps.title: Create Counter component
steps.description: Create a new Counter functional component that uses the useState hook to manage the count state.

steps.title: Add increment and decrement buttons
steps.description: Add increment and decrement buttons to the Counter component that update the count state when clicked.

steps.title: Style Counter with CSS modules
steps.description: Create a CSS module for the Counter component. Style the count display and buttons.

steps.title: Add reset button
steps.description: Add a reset button to the Counter component that sets the count state back to 0 when clicked.

steps.title: Conditionally style count based on value
steps.description: Update the Counter CSS module to display the count in red when negative and green when positive.

steps.title: Add documentation
steps.description: Write basic documentation explaining how to use the Counter component and describing the props it accepts, if any.

steps.title: Test Counter component
steps.description: Write unit tests to verify the functionality of the Counter component, including the increment, decrement, and reset buttons.
